content: Which famous artist painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City, depicting scenes from the Book of Genesis?

That would be Michelangelo Buonarroti, one of the most renowned artists of the Renaissance period. His work on the Sistine Chapel ceiling is indeed a masterpiece, featuring iconic scenes such as the Creation of Adam, where God touches Adam's finger to impart life. It's a testament to his skill and vision.
